channel.title: Properties :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: Properties A property is used syntactically like a field of a class or structure, but provides greater flexibility in implementation. For example, the string class contains a public property called Length. This property is accessed in code much as if it were a public int field; i.e., if s is a string variable, we can access its Length property with the expression s.Length, which evaluates to an int. If Length were a public int field, we would access it in just the same way.
